reasoning='1.  Motor capability: 24 V BLDC delivers 0.3 Nm at 4 000 rpm (ωₘ = 4 000·2π/60 = 418.9 rad s⁻¹).  Mechanical power available = T·ω ≈ 0.3 Nm·418.9 rad s⁻¹ ≈ 126 W (80 % efficient → 158 W electrical).

2.  Choose a practical wheel diameter.  150 mm (d = 0.15 m) is common for small ground robots and keeps the required torque modest while allowing good speed.

3.  Speed constraint (≥ 3 m s⁻¹).
    • Relationship: v = (ωₘ / r)·(d/2).
    • With ωₘ = 418.9 rad s⁻¹ and d = 0.15 m, the gear ratio must satisfy
          v = 418.9·0.15 /(2 r) = 31.42 / r ≥ 3  →  r ≤ 10.47.

4.  Grade-climbing torque constraint (10° incline).
    • Resistive force: F = m g sinθ + C_r m g cosθ, with θ = 10°, C_r = 0.015.
      ⇒ F ≈ m g(0.17365 + 0.015·0.9848) ≈ 0.18842 m g ≈ 1.848 m  (N).
    • Wheel torque required: T_req = F·(d/2) = 0.924 m d ≈ 0.924 m·0.15 = 0.1386 m (Nm).
    • Available wheel torque: T_wheel = T_motor·r = 0.3·r (Nm).
      Need 0.3 r ≥ 0.1386 m → r ≥ 0.462 m.

5.  Pick a light "body" mass m = 8 kg (including structure, electronics and payload).
    • Lower-bound ratio: r ≥ 0.462·8 = 3.70.
    • Upper-bound ratio from speed: r ≤ 10.47.
      A mid-value r = 6 satisfies both.
    • Check:  Top speed  v = 31.42 / 6 ≈ 5.24 m s⁻¹  (> 3 m s⁻¹).  
      Climb torque  T_wheel = 0.3·6 = 1.8 Nm ≥ T_req = 0.1386·8 = 1.11 Nm, so the robot can ascend the 10° slope.

6.  Cruise-energy requirement (30 min at 2.5 m s⁻¹ on level ground).
    • Rolling force: F_roll = C_r m g = 0.015·8·9.81 ≈ 1.18 N.
    • Aero drag (A = 0.05 m², ρ = 1.225 kg m⁻³, C_d ≈ 1):
        F_drag = ½ρC_dAv² = 0.5·1.225·1·0.05·2.5² ≈ 0.19 N.
      Total force ≈ 1.37 N.
    • Mechanical power P_mech = F·v ≈ 1.37·2.5 = 3.42 W.
      Electrical power P_elec = P_mech / η ≈ 3.42 / 0.8 = 4.28 W.
    • Energy for 0.5 h → 4.28 W·0.5 h ≈ 2.14 Wh.
      A 30 Wh Li-ion pack (common 7 × 18650 24 V nominal) gives >10× margin for inefficiencies, accelerations, and reserve capacity.

7.  Final parameter set that fulfils all constraints:
      • Wheel diameter d = 0.15 m.
      • Gear ratio r = 6 : 1 (motor : wheel).
      • Body/robot mass m = 8 kg.
      • Battery capacity C = 30 Wh.

These choices meet the speed target (>3 m s⁻¹), supply enough torque to climb a 10° incline, and provide more than 30 minutes of cruising at 2.5 m s⁻¹ with plenty of energy margin.' config=ConfigFile(battery_capacity=30.0, gear_ratio=6.0, wheel_diameter=0.15, body_mass=8.0)
